data.title: Colleges & Universities Near Davenport, Iowa
data.meta_description: Looking for a list of the best colleges and universities in Davenport, Iowa? Get a detailed list and breakdown of colleges near Davenport, Iowa here.
data.text:
Colleges Near Davenport, Iowa

Looking for information about the best colleges and universities serving Davenport? Here's your guide to the top schools offering degrees to students in the area, including institutions located within 10 miles of Davenport, Iowa.

There are at least 9 colleges serving the area, including 5 private colleges and universities, 0 public colleges and universities, and 2 community colleges offering 2-year degrees.

The Best Adult Colleges & Careers Guide provides a breakdown of the colleges serving Davenport, with details about cost, enrollment, student type and degree offerings. Click here to learn more about the guide.

Davenport, Iowa Colleges by the Numbers

Associate, bachelor's, masters, and doctoral degree completions at institutions near Davenport, Iowa have been declining over the past 5 years. In 2022, students completed 3,781 doctorates at colleges and universities near Davenport. That was a decrease of 10% from completions reported in 2018.

Top School For Adults & Online Students

Franklin University is a top choice for transfer students, online learners and adults who need to balance school with busy lives. Founded in 1902 in Columbus, Ohio, Franklin's main focus has been serving adult students and tailoring education to fit their needs. Nonprofit and accredited by the Higher Learning Commission (hlcommission.org/800.621.7440), Franklin offers more than 50 bachelor's, master's, and doctoral programs — all available 100% online.

Private Colleges & Universities Offering Degrees Near Davenport, Iowa

There are at least 5 schools offering degrees near Davenport, Iowa, and 5 are four-year private colleges or universities where about 9,128 undergraduate students were enrolled. In 2022, a total of 4,276 degrees were completed at private colleges and universities, including 2,064 that were offered online.

Franklin offers more than 50 online bachelor's degrees, master's degrees and doctoral programs in the Davenport, Iowa area. Franklin University is an institutionally accredited nonprofit 4-year school where most students attend classes part-time. Most of the students are adults and all programs completed were offered online. Bachelor's degrees are the most popular at Franklin University. In 2022, 1,011 bachelor's degrees were completed. In addition, 94 associate degrees, 676 master's degrees, and 39 doctoral degrees were earned.

Affordable Colleges Near Davenport, Iowa

Wondering what you can expect to pay for a degree near Davenport, Iowa? According to undergraduate tuition data from the U.S. Department of Education College Scorecard, the average tuition at Davenport-area's 4-year nonprofit schools is $26,221. The average tuition at similar 4-year for-profit schools near Davenport is N/A, while tuition at 2-year online colleges and universities is N/A.

Accredited Colleges Serving Davenport, Iowa

Earning a college degree is an investment — and earning a degree from an institutionally accredited university is one of the best ways to ensure your education is of high quality. Institutionally accredited universities are held to rigorous standards by state and regional bodies and undergo regular reviews to verify that their processes and academic programs meet the proper standards.

Wondering if a certain college or university offering degree programs in Davenport, Iowa is institutionally accredited? View a list of institutionally accredited colleges and universities serving Davenport, Iowa here. We've made it easy to find your school by breaking down the list by school type.
